Articles.Content:
Not sure if anyone has asked but... why can't you give Reputation to someone in The Space Lounge section of the forum?

This must be intentional. However I can't think of a good reason. It would be nice to give rep for a good post in any forum section.

Anyone else think the same?

Can a mod provide a reason for this at least - happy to be persuaded with a good reason.
I can't think of a reason for this either, I'll ask around and if noone has an answer I'll change it
As far as I recall, the reason was that rep was supposed to actually mean something, rather than being awarded for all sorts of off-topic stuff, and forum games.
Making a funny post in General discussion and one in Off-topic has the same value.
The value in question was its relevance and contribution to Kerbal related matters.
Even so, I feel like it'd be okay if rep was useful in the Lounge, too -- but it probably should be nonexistent in the Forum Games section.
Enabled it in the Space Lounge

As far as I recall, the reason was that rep was supposed to actually mean something, rather than being awarded for all sorts of off-topic stuff, and forum games.

Anything that is not KSP is worthless... Especially your freedom and happiness.

Even so, I feel like it'd be okay if rep was useful in the Lounge, too -- but it probably should be nonexistent in the Forum Games section.

Boooooooo Boooooooo ... honey boooo booooo @ Vexx can't you feel the patterns everywhere ?

just saying i ll be curious if i was able 2 see to some rep attrib stat (sorted) from here and why not there.

Edited June 30, 2014 by WinkAllKerb''

Forum games has more KSP related things than the space lounge.

EDIT: let's take the first 5 pages as an example, thread count is 7:3 to forum games.

Edited June 30, 2014 by Spartwo
Let's not forget that rep is just arbitrary useless and meaningless internet points that do not serve any purpose at all, not even sure why there's a fuss about it

Let's not forget that rep is just arbitrary useless and meaningless internet points that do not serve any purpose at all, not even sure why there's a fuss about it

It makes you feel cool, and shows which users are the most popular.

It makes you feel cool, and shows which users are the most popular.

Once you realize how meaningless they are, you don't feel as cool Besides, if only popularity meant quality...

It can also serve as a little "thank you" without cluttering up the fora (that said, the "must spread rep around" works directly against that - IMO, rep is better if attached to posts and not users, than to users and not posts).

as stated meaningless by stupid_chris would prefer to give some for having a good kerbalistick laugh

(laughing is good for health i heard so might desserve some rep no ? ;op )

Once you realize how meaningless they are, you don't feel as cool Besides, if only popularity meant quality...

Yes, Hitler was extremely popular, but killed millions of people... (maybe that's not the best example, but whatevs)

I dunno, it's not totally useless. If you look at the members with the most rep, most of them are good contributors to the community. (Except me, most of my rep is due to the proximity of the "Give Rep" button to the "Report Post" button.)
